page.title: 19EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Maybole's record as an important manufacturing centre predates W.W.2. In the late 19thC. and early 20thC. the town had an international reputation for the production of quality footwear. Over two thousand employees were needed in the local factories and tanneries. There is now only a single one_man workshop continuing the old skills. Dick Goudie makes quality work boots by hand in a process which is now a historical curiosity. Local factories also produced agricultural machinery. Since 1945 the town has undergone a serious industrial decline. A variety of businesses exist currently in the town (ref. INDUSTRY ) but none are large scale employers. Many people travel to Ayr, Girvan or further afield for work Maybole is becoming a residential area for regional industrial centres.
